meanings.definition: To draw off or convey (a liquid) by means of a tube or pipe.
meanings.sent1: I syphoned water from the bucket into the watering can.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic syphoned the oil from the engine for maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel syphoned the bird bath water for its own tiny pool.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to be syphoned from a deep well of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The magician syphoned the colored liquid from one glass to another, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: To divert or steal (money or resources) for one's own use.
meanings.sent1: The thief syphoned funds from the charity account.
meanings.sent2: She suspected her coworker had syphoned ideas from her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to syphon treats from the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: His charisma seemed to syphon attention away from the main speaker.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to syphon the light from the sky, creating an eerie atmosphere.
